reviewText:
A really cute and nice game with a lots of fun and challange. I would recommend this game for everyone, who likes challanges, who isn't afraid of going for a level over and over again to beat his/her best time, or for even beat that ****ing level finally. I won't say it will be an easy game, sometimes you might want to kill every person involved in the making of this game, BUT it is a game what really worth to pick up.

Whats good in the game:
Challanging levels
Puzzle levels
Great enviroment and good looking levels
Several hours of gameplay
You can play the levels over and over again and it still not boring
Cute potato shaped bees
Some secret to discover
etc.
If you like indie games, or platform games, or want to rest from the other games, this is a good choice.
And with the developer daily streams  well... almost daily  everyone could feel they were part of the game making.

After this project the dev will probably have a lots of other project, so if you free definitely check that one out too!

10/10 would have this game again!
voteText: 19 of 20 people (95%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText: Recursion Deluxe is a quaint little 8-bit puzzle platformer. Gradually ramping up in difficulty over the course of 60 mind-bending levels (that I'm aware of at the time of this writing), the game utilizes gravity switching, reminiscent of parts of LIMBO, and other physics based game mechanics, to allow you to solve puzzles and reach the level exit. Along the way you'll try to avoid hungry zombies and angry bees (NOT THE BEES!), but clever players can not only avoid them, but dispatch them for good, making it much easier to finish the level. Recursion Deluxe should scratch your retro and masochistic itches in equal measure. RECOMMENDED!

reviewText:
A Platformer / Puzzle Gamehttps://youtu.be/P45Vaw1kxS0
+ Great retro art style / graphics
+ Nice chiptune sountrack
+ Level's are short (which I found great for puzzle game like this) They get longer later on
+ The difficulty curve is low, typically in games like this they get way too hard too quickly but this game seems to gradually get harder but slowly so you can relax and enjoy the game

- The mechanics are pretty basic, you just move and jump
- From what I can tell, you can't use the Xbox One controller with this game Dev Response
- You can't kill enemies early on (I feel like it would have been a bit more enjoyable if you could jump on their heads to kill them) You can kill them later in the game

Originally posted by Andy:There are mechanics in the game later on where you have to kill the enemies, but we felt like having the enemies killable by jumping on them would be too limiting design wise with the single screen level size. I do think different enemy types might have been a good idea since everyone tries to jump on the zombees when they first encounter them.

The game does get harder later on and the level length continues to grow, the first world definitely feels very short in comparison to the rest of the game.

We will be fixing the xbox one controller issue shortly, we believe it has to do with an odd deadzone with that controller on windows 10.

You have me on the basic mechanics though, if you want a game with shooting or wall jumping, that's not this game. We were going more for a puzzle style and wanted to focus on that =)

reviewText:
Nice light puzzle platformer.

Killer chiptunes, good pixel art, gradually increasing difficulty.

My biggest con is the jumping and movement feels sort of sluggish and floaty.  There is too much inertia upon letting go of controls that makes landing precise jumps and stopping on a dime tough.

Also.. it's 2016.  I realize this is a retro inspired 2D indie game... but modifying my resolution through a text file?  Come on man.

reviewText: Don't be fooled by the simple retro graphical style, this is no run-of-the-mill platformer, it is genuinely fun, has some really nice gameplay ideas and really good level design that actually makes you think. The music is inkeeping with the style and not too annoying. If I had one bone to pick it would be the placement of the restart button (sometimes you'll hit it accidentally right when you're about to win a really difficult level). But definitely recommend!

reviewText:
This game was absolutely amazing.  I played this game for my Dev Support Saturday stream on Twitch, not knowing at all what to expect.  Generally, I give these games 45 minutes tops, and then move on to the next game.  Well, 45 minutes turned into 4 hours, and that turned into a beaten game, as I absolutely loved this game from start to finish.

The music is great, the level design is great, the platforming is great.  And there's a ton of replayability.  It's turned into honestly one of my favorite games in this genre, and that's saying quite a lot.

I give this 10 Llama Stars out of 9.  Yep, out of 9.

reviewText:
A charming puzzle platformer with an emphasis on puzzles, timing and precision.

There's nothing particularly new at work here, though most of the levels are well crafted and unique feeling. The main gimmicks are the non-euclidean geometry and gravity reversal, with plenty of switches, keys and obstacles to make for interesting puzzle solving and platform jumping. It definitely feels like a game I've played before, and yet it kept my attention from beginning to end.

The game is quite short, but for the price seems about right. The difficulty curve is slow and steady, with most of the game feeling a bit on the easy side, though I do consider myself well-traveled in this genre. Most of the challenge comes from collecting the game's completely optional stars, and dying has no penalty.

Recommended to puzzle fans, platforming fans, and retro game fans alike.

reviewText:
Full disclosure: Review is based on a press copy given to me by the developer.

Recursion Deluxe is an accessible, yet challenging, game that will test both your twitch platforming skills along with your puzzle solving aptitude.  I've included my full thoughts in video form here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X8x3neaGjRc

- Graphically charming
- Catchy soundtrack
- Tight controls
- Excellent level design
- Enticing 'one more try' gameplay

I feel the level design in particular is worth expanding upon a bit more.  Levels and level progression are designed to teach the player the mechanics naturally through gameplay.  There's no tutorials here, just design that promotes learning.  Mechanics are introduced one at a time throughout the levels, allowing you to both feel like you're getting a grasp on things and feel accomplished when you put all the pieces together to complete a particularly difficult level.

Also, at $5 it's hard to pass up!

reviewText: I'm a fan of games in which entire rooms are puzzles. So this game was immediately interesting. I have to say though, it does a fantastic job of easing the player into new mechanics and ideas without hindering the flow. There aren't any obnoxious tutorials breaking up the flow or unchallenging learning areas". The mechanics are simple enough
date: but the way in which they are put together make for deeper puzzles and encourage lateral thinking. When you die your character immediately respawns and the puzzle is reset
recommended: so you're put right back into the game without any waiting time. I can see myself playing this a lot between breaks. I'd love to see a mobile version!"

reviewText:
Full Video Review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=72vasmht9-U

Disclaimer: I was provided a key for free, though I was not paid for this review or told to say positive things. My opinions are my own.

I thought this game was great. For $5, you really can't beat the experience. I felt it was a great idea for a mobile game, but after playing it for awhile it does play fine on PC as well. The concept of shifting between edges of the screen, then also flipping upside down and such is pretty cool and something that is hard to pull off, but Recursion Deluxe does it well. Add in a level editor, twitch plays support and more free DLC/content in the future, this is a great pick up for the low price of $5.

reviewText:
This game, in all it's cutness and pixels, is the most evil thing I've encountered in a very long time.

It's like the girl you met in highschool, with her beautiful smile, and bright blue eyes. Prom comes, and all the work you did over the summer to afford the limo, the tux is about to pay off.
You go together, hand in hand and you look at her face and it's the most radiant, beautiful thing you've ever seen.

Then, without warning or hesitation she pulls out a crowbar and brutally hits you in the ♥♥♥♥ with it! What just happened? Why does this hurt so bad?!

And while you lay there on the floor, pouring blood from your genitalia; she starts having sex with your best friend.

It’s a lot like that. This game, as beautiful and as cute as it may seem, will turn on you. Like an abused Pitbull from a rescue shelter.

Seriously, it’s 5 bucks, and I’ve never had more fun being more angry at how deceptively difficult a game was.

10/10 GOTY, would take to prom and cry on the floor again.

And for those of you that don’t believe me, you can watch me rage right here:
http://www.twitch.tv/stuffedcastle/v/44166896

reviewText:
Retro graphics and old skool super addictive puzzle platformer. It gets so frustratingly annoying you just have to beat the level! Great work 2D Heroes and Ursa Games.

Being able to mod the game adds more longevity and the chance to unleash your creative side. Can you design the ultimate level to frustrate your friends?

I recommend you purchase this as it's the Civilization equivalent of the puzzle platformer genre, just ONE more go!

reviewText:
Full disclosure, I am the content designer for the game and such I don't feel right reviewing the levels.

I will say, the music in this game is Fantasic and very catchy! The programming provides a very solid platforming engine with tight controls and responsive deterministic gameplay with a lot of fun mechanics that intertwine together. The artwork in the game is extremly cute and a joy to design levels with.

What I will say about the game content: I've been working really hard to make a game that has an entertaining difficulty curve. I aimed at having it start out easy and slowly become more challenging as you progress. I've been tweaking a few of the levels since release and the flow of the game should improve as I continue to get feedback from players and watch let's plays of the game. I want the game to be fun and challenging, but not too frustrating.

Also, all of the tools that I used to create levels are available to anyone who buys the game to create their own level packs.

reviewText:
Takes me back to my C64 childhood an 8bit homage to Rainbow Islands and Bubble Bobble that doesn't suck.

[ Fun: 8 | CTRL: 8 | GFX: 8 | SFX: 8 | Stable: Y | Replay: 9 ] [ Total : 8 ]

+ Charming retro graphics
+ Simple mechanics making cunning puzzles
+ Level design makes wonderful use of limited space
+ Pitch perfect music
+ Hugely replayable

~ Lacks variety in some of the sprites
~ Some tough levels require repartition
~ Brittle block very slow to crumble
~ Promises of updates by the devs

- Nothing bad I can think of, more levels maybe?
